reviews.review_msg: Textbook? Sucks. Prof? Boring and uninteresting. Grading Scheme? Not even really based on interpretation of history. Don't ever take this course, coming from a History major. Way too hard for a 100 Level course. 1.5 hours to write 3 essays. You've got to be joking. Don't ever take during COVID times.

Andrea is literally the sweetest. She is so soft spoken, caring, and encouraging. Assignments were fairly easy and she gives good feedback. There was a lot of reading but if youre interested in the topic then its a super rewarding course. Take her if you can!!!

One of the best professors at SFU. Andrea is super passionate about the subjects she teaches and her lectures are amazing. She's super caring and accessible outside of class to chat or if you need help. Be prepared to read a lot but if you're interested in the subject it won't be bad at all.
Worst prof ever at SFU, she expects too much from students, there are around 100 pages per week where you have to read.

I've taken 3 upper level courses with her,highly recommend her. Is a fair marker and gives thorough feedback on work. She's responsive to student's concerns and encouraging. She assigns interesting material especially if you like north american history, migration and borderlands history. She is very willing to help students.
I have taken 2 courses with Andrea. She's really kind and is readily available to help you, especially if you show dedication and desire to learn. I think she is pretty fair with marking.

I love Dr. Geiger! She's extremely informative and incredibly knowledgeable in her field of study, and her feedback on your work is always very helpful. She's awesome at facilitating class discussion, though will sometimes go on long tangents. Prepare to read!
I think she is one of the best History Profs at SFU. Very caring and willing to help you. She is also very knowledgeable and open to others opinions/views. A kind lady.

Kind, genuine, and clear prof. Assignmentsexaminations are fair, you just have to put in the work. Presentation style is not the most exciting, but you'll certainly learn a lot from this course. Ignore the slides, they do you no good, with exception to the maps. Take thorough notes, the details come in handy.

While I appreciated her intentions, and the course itself - I found the course fairly boring and lacking charecter. Many of the discussions could've been left to a lower level history course, and she teaches little to no historical insight of her own; instead drawing on the ideas of others. Her assignments are fairly easy - just slightly obtuse.

Prfo Geiger is hands down one of my favourite profs ever. She is very sweet and helpful, and she knows a LOT about what she teaches. I took a writing course with her so there was a lot of reading and writing, but a fair amount. Fair grader. Very passionate and interested in hearing everyone's perspectives. I recommend her to everyone.

loved the course. great textbook. readings were not that bad, about 1 chapter a week. 2 papers. the last paper is your final.  interesting lectures, informative lectures.  a good class to take if you like writing and arnt too bad at it.
As noted by numerous others lectures are extremely boring, but if you go to tutorials (assuming a good TA) the class itself is fairly easy.  Prepare for a lot of reading though.
Worst Professor I have ever had. Moralizes heavily for no reason. Has a very boring voice. Worst textbooks I have encountered. Marking scheme not really based on history knowledge. Extremely Prudish.

Yes, she makes you work for your grades. No, she is not incoherent or boring, she is very illuminating and has an interesting perspective on history. She encourages discussion and is open to her students opinions. I can see why her ratings would be bad for a 100 level class, because the material she covers actually requires some profound analysis.
Boring, to the nth degree. Lectures are terribly incoherent and uninteresting. And she marks way to hard considering its a 100 level class. AVOID AT ALL COST.
Painful class, terrible prof

The textbook was dense, uninteresting, and jumped around. Primary sources were sometimes photocopies of original documents, and were at times indistinguishable from a smudge on the page. Lectures were dry, uninteresting, and mostly reiterated what the textbook said in more depth. I won't be taking another class with her.
i would not take another class with her. if you voice an opinion incongruent with hers, she will abruptly dismiss yours. lectures are dreadful!

Really Great!  Very sweet woman, and she really makes the classroom an inclusive place.  Discussion is welcome and lively.  She is a difficult marker, but if you put in the work, you will get a pretty decent grade

not a fun class to take at all. the lectures were really boring and hard to follow, and there were way to many readings to keep up with the lectures in the first place. she seems very unwilling to sypmathize with her students who expressed concerns about the amount of readings. Its a hard course to take at a 100 level..avoid it if you can!!!

Andrea's a good prof with a passion for what she teaches. She sees to love her students. She does play favourites, so get in early (it WILL effect your mark). I would take a class of hers again for sure.
not a good proff, doesnt teach much in lectures, dont take this class unless you absolutley have to, i regret it big time

Definitely has her own agenda - she's a real left-winger. She also clearly specializes in and prefers Pacific (namely Asian) to Atlantic migration - she corrected factual 'errors' on my European paper that were right out of a text book. She is indeed a very nice and friendly lady, but has little interest outside of her speciality.

This is an excellent class to take. Andrea was a wonderful instructor who offered organized and clear lectures. If you follow her instructions for assignments it was very easy to get a good grade. She was ALWAYS willing to make time to see you for assignments and questions, and she offers fantastic advice.
Plays clear favourites. Lectures are incoherent. Avoid at all costs.
Unethical and pretentious. More interested in espousing her own beliefs than in facilitating open discussion.
